$x_1$ (terbricmi) is bound to $x_2$ (sumti) by relationship $x_3$ (relationship with two {ce'u} for $x_1$ and $x_2$)
column3: Used to more precisely express relationship (whether fuzzy or not) between terbricmi (predicate slots) and arguments (sumti) filling those slots.  See also {ckini}, {va'e}, {jei}, {sela'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is an enclave of $x_2$
$x_1$ is an (arbitrary) $x_2$-set (li) of superset $x_3$; $x_1$ is subset/subgroup/subcategory/subclass/vel sim. of $x_3$ with cardinality/size $x_2$.
column3: $x_1$ is empty if(f) $x_2 = 0$, which is possible; $x_1$ may or may not be a proper substructure ({praperi}) of $x_3$. $x_2$ is a nonnegative cardinal. The two distinguishing features of $x_1$ are its size ($x_2$) and the object/structure ($x_3$) to which it belongs/which contains it. Any $x_2$ elements of $x_3$ can belong to $x_1$ as long as the total count is correct; no particular collection is necessarily included. It is bad form for $x_2$ to strictly exceed the size/cardinality of $x_3$ and, necessarily, no such object/structure can exist. See also: {klesi}, {praperi}, {cletu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a copula, a verb-like word linking $x_2$ (ordered group)
column3: In $x_2$ the first element is usually the subject of a clause, the second is a a subject complement or an adverbial that is united or associated with the subject.

column2: $g_1$ is $g_2$ henry/henries of inductance (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.

$x_1$ has enryo (Japanese term) in actions $x_2$; $x_1$ acts egoistically to retain their own freedom, prevent their own embarrassment and at the same time acts altruistically by avoiding social involvement without hurting others; $x_1$ socially restrains themselves under the pressure of group solidarity and conformity in order not to hurt other's feelings; $x_1$ is polite
$x_1$ is a letter written in roman, upright font
$x_1$ is an essay (literary composition) about $x_2$
$x_1$ sends an SMS; $x_1$ sends SMS $x_2$; $x_1$ sends SMS $x_2$ to $x_3$
$x_1$ is a letter having serifs $x_2$
column3: Serif is a short line added to the top or bottom of letter. See also {sanserife}, {kursive}

column2: $x_1$ (text) is written in a dialect where every bridi has arguments expressed in content/patient/recipient/stimulus semantic cases schema
column3: Labels of roles: {fa} for content, {fe} for patient, {fi} for recipient, {fo} for stimulus, {ja'i} for the rules describing the semantic cases schema. Additional semantic cases might be used, e.g. {sepi'o} (instrument role), {ri'i} (experiencer role), {ri'a} (enabler role), {gau} (agent role). To be used with {sei}. To use only for a given bridi without affecting child bridi the transformation 'SELBRI => SELBRI .ensi' can be used (as an alternative to using {sei}) thus putting {ensi} as the tertau of a newly formed selbri. See also {jo'au}, {ilki}, {esme}, {onga}.

column2: $x_1$ is an encyclopaedia with content $x_2$
$x_1$ is the order(ing) which endows $x_2$ ((partially) ordered nonempty set or class).
$x_1$ is a taur of type/species/mythology $x_2$
column3: A generalized centaur. Typically, both halves are of the same animal and furred, but retains the shape of a centaur. See {kentauru}, {ckemono}

column2: $x_1$ is a theater showing plays $x_2$
$x_1$ (proposition) is a theory of $x_2$ (proposition); $x_1$ (proposition) is a system of explanations of structure, basic principles or behavior of $x_2$ (proposition)
$x_1$ (amount) is the entropy of system $x_2$ under conditions/in macrostate $x_3$, where the entropy is of type/calculated via formula $x_4$.
column3: Any type of entropy (specified by $x_4$, tanru, "{pe}", etc.) is allowed, not just Boltzmann entropy (= ".{entropi} {foi'e} {pe} {la} .boltsman."); Boltzmann entropy should be named as such; the entropy need not be logarithmic. $x_2$ must be a system in the physical sense. See also: {boltsemaku}, {ciste}, {kalte}, {cunso}, {zildatni}.

column2: $x_1$ is enthusiastic, excited about $x_2$ (event / property of $x_1$)
column3: See also {gleki}, {cinmo}, {zdile}, {cmila}, {cisma}, {xanka} or {carmi} {akti} for the meaning 'excited (in high energy state)'

column2: $x_1$, in aspect $x_2$, reflects the culture/lifestyle/people of a non-native (immigrant/invading/alien) population/culture $x_3$ which at least partially but significantly and somewhat permanently (having established itself) locally supplanted, displaced, or dominated the indigenous/native culture $x_4$ in region $x_5$ (location)
column3: Native American cultures  ({rindo}) would qualify as $x_3$, with  $x_5$ being a superset of the Americas ({bemjoitco}), whereas the Euramerican cultures that replaced them would be $x_3$. Foreignness/indigenosity are not sufficient; the foreign population (and, even more importantly, culture) must come to dominate the indigenous one, at least locally.

column2: $x_1$ exists/is real in universe-of-discourse $x_2$
column3: Proposed alternate definition of {zasti}. See {munje}, {enfasnu}, {li'i'e}. $x_2$ can be {lo} {fatci}, or a system, real or imagined, including a "story universe"; thus, e.g. unicorns (probably) don't exist with $x_2$={lo} {fatci}, but they'd exist in the stories where they exist.

column2: $x_1$ is a mountain zebra (Equus zebra).
$x_1$ in an enzyme that catalyzes chemical reactions $x_2$.
attitudinal: \n{e'o } - request\n{e'o nai} - negative request.
$x_1$ asks/requests $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$
digit/number: dual ε of dual number in linear algebra; square root of 0
column3: $ε^2=0$ so $ε$ is nilpotent. Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the dual parts of a dual number); normally prefixed with {lau}. See also {ri'o}, {ka'o}.

column2: $x_1$ is a birch of species $x_2$
$x_1$ [observer] senses / detects / notices $x_2$ (object / nu) without stimulating sensory perception organs; $x_1$ hallucinates
$x_1$ does hermeneutics/exegesis analysis of $x_2$ (text); $x_1$ interprets $x_2$ as a given wisdom; $x_1$ is an exegete
$x_1$ is a stoat/ermine of subspecies $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a hedgehog of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ reflects Irish/Hibernian culture/geography/nation/history/language in property $x_2$
column3: {brito} .{erno} for Northern Irish (or be more specific such as for Ulster-Scots/Hiberno-English); perhaps "{skoto} .{erno}" for Celtic Irish/modern  (Republic of) Ireland. This word refers to the largest sense of Irishness  (including the whole island), usually.

column2: $x_1$ (abstraction) is the purpose of $x_2$ (object or event)
column3: See {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}. Syn. {kosmu}. Note that this is not a mere short-form; this word is agent-less. (≈ te pilno be fi zi'o)

column2: $x_1$ (proposition) is asserted once it contains within the given context no errors otherwise $x_2$ (proposition) is asserted
column3: Corresponds to exception handling in programming languages. Errors may include checking for semantic errors, type errors; for checking for grammar errors use {lo'u}. See also {ifle}, {srera}, {smudra}.

column2: $x_1$ is a buckeye/horse chestnut tree (member of genus Aesculus) of subtaxon/cultivar $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a pike of species/breed $x_2$
$g_1$ is $g_2$ hertz of frequency (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$x_1$ is skilled at satisfying property $x_2$, relatively to $x_3$.
column3: May or may not be synonymous with {certu}. The word "expert" in the definition of {certu} leads some people to take it with a strong reading, i.e. "very/extremely skilled".

column2: $x_1$ buys $x_2$ from $x_3$ for price $x_4$
$x_1$ is worth buying (from vendor $x_2$ at price $x_3$)
$x_1$ squats/bends deeply at the knees while resting on their feet
$x_1$ is an escort/bodyguard/chaperon of $x_2$

$x_1$ is the text for $x_2$ (concept) according to $x_3$ in language $x_4$; $x_1$ is how $x_3$ would word $x_2$ in language $x_4$; $x_3$ would say $x_1$ when they would want to communicate $x_2$ in language $x_4$; $x_1$ is text(ual) / a quote (meaningful) in language $x_4$.
$x_1$ (text) is written in a dialect where {su'o}, {ro} quantifiers are treated as {su'oi}, {ro'oi} respectively
column3: '{sei} {esme}'/'{sei} {na} {esme}' is a method of switching to/from this particular plural logic quantifiers' style in Lojban. Expected usage as a 'free' is in the following rules: {jarnezi}, {mei} {zei} {ni'orsu}, {xa zei sumtika}. {lo} {broda} is treated as {su'oi} {broda}.

column2: $x_1$ is an open-mid front unrounded vowel sound produced by $x_2$.
column3: Synonym: {esnce}. Both are derived from {ebu zei sance}.
column5: E sound;low-mid front unrounded vowel;open-mid front unrounded vowel

column2: $x_1$ is an open-mid front unrounded vowel sound produced by $x_2$.
column3: Synonym: {esna}. Both are derived from and synonymous with {ebu zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient vowel in the stressed syllable.
column5: E sound;low-mid front unrounded vowel;open-mid front unrounded vowel;open-mid front unrounded vowel sound

column2: $x_1$ is a spelt (a kind of wheat) of variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is semen/sperm fluid/generative substance of male animal $x_2$

column3: For types of sports use {le'a}. See also {zajba}, {xadykelci'e}.

column2: $x_1$ is a strawberry of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ pertain to Estonian language in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is a starling/Sturnidae of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an ester derived from acid $x_2$ and alcohol $x_3$
$x_1$ is $x_2$ dunams in area by standard $x_3$
column3: 1000 m², except for the Iraqi dunam and the former Turkish dönüm.

column2: $x_1$ is/are Echinus/sea urchin of species $x_2$
$x_1$ suggests/advices $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$
$x_1$ (record, movie) has the dimension $x_2$ (ka)
column3: $x_1$ can be {vreji}, {skina}, {draci}. $x_2$ can specify length in time, space dimensions of its frames ({kantu}). See also {tcidu}, {skicu}, {zgana}, {ze'a}, {temci}, {canlu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'space-offset' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: FAhA NAI? VA?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: an affectionate nickname or diminutive for "Mallory" with an implied "cmalu"
Nameless.
name: forgetful stubborn supporter of pre-Dotside Lojban.
Darussalam.
Duckburg
Eris
espasol, cylinder-shaped or other-shaped Filipino rice cake cooked in coconut milk, dusted with toasted rice flour
Esperanto
Austria
superfective inchoative; starting too late
column3: Opposite of {xa'o} by {co'a}; also opposite of {co'u'a}.

column2: placed after a tanru with CO, following sumti return to the place structure of the left tanru unit.
column3: broda co brode do = "broda co brode be do", however "broda co brode co'ai do" = "broda be do co brode". Overrides the rule that sumti following a tanru with CO belong to the place structure of the right tanru unit. Scope of a single CO; "broda co brode co brodi" would need "co'ai" once to return to "brode" and twice to return to "broda". Proposed rafsi: -cox-. See also: {co}.

column2: Non-committal/agnostic/unassertive/abstaining/neutral tanru inversion.
column3: This is not merely the assertion that any or some other CO will work (which is the elliptical case: {co'o'e}) nor that some connective between the identity ({co'au'e}) and full ({co}) inverses would do (such as: {co'au'ejoico}, {co'au'ejaco}, etc.; notice that these decompose into two distinct bridi which are connected as indicated). It is the assertion that the utterer does not care which CO is used here or that they are not necessarily asserting one way or the other (in fact, they are actively asserting a neutral or abstaining stance).
column5: abstaining tanru inversion;agnostic tanru inversion;neutral tanru inversion

column2: interval event contour: at the restarting/renewal point of...
column3: The event is being considered somewhat/approximately cyclic in nature on the large scale; the point in question is an end point for one version of going through the cycle once and the point at which the next version begins. The previous cycle need not have reached or exceeded its natural completion/conclusion. This word is useful for when a player restarts a level in a game - the choices made within the level may not be exactly the same, but much of it nonetheless is extremely similar between attempts. "Redouble" may have this meaning. Use this word when one is not at the true (last) end of an event, nor its true (first) beginning, yet is at an end and a begin.

column2: trivial selbri inversion: does not invert tanru (seltau first/left, tertau second/right).
column3: This is the default in Lojban and can often be elided. (Re)asserts local left-grouping if used multiple times (just as {co} asserts right-grouping). Mostly used in answer to {co'u'o} or in order to be explicit or to override grouping rules.
column5: tanru non-inversion;tanru order-exchange identity;trivial tanru inversion

column2: Elliptical elliptical. Beware, its grammar is also elliptical.
column3: u'ivla. The abstaining/agnostic version of this word was not considered based on pragmatic and philosophical reasons. What are things that are even unsaying that they are things?

column2: discursive & gafyzmico: reset/restore all defaults (permanently) to discourse-exterior specification; cancel all following discourse-interior default assignments
column3: Any modification made to the default value of all terbri is hereby cancelled and the definitions of all words (with respect to default specifications for terbri), as they explicitly appear in official Lojban word lists and other resources, is hereby used. Permanent until future alterations (with respect to terbri default specifications) is explicitly made. See also: {do'ai}, {zmico}, {gafyzmico}, {da'o}.
column5: cancel default assignment;reset defaults;restore default settings

column2: attitudinal attribution
column3: Whereas {dai} simply marks an attitudinal as applying to someone other than the speaker, da'oi explicitly attributes the preceding attitudinal.  In particular, dai is equivalent to da'oi na'e bo mi.

column2: gafyzmico: Reset all default specifications of immediately previous word to official definition specifications hereinafter (permanently)
column3: Restores all default specifications in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and {di'au} that may fill the terbri of that word are predefined/specific in reference and do indeed necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-external/“official” definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default restoration (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so restored all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. Affects all future uses of the word (permanent), until the end of the text/conversation or explicitly undone in some manner. See also: {doi'a}, {de'au}, {zmico}.
column5: default reset (across all associated terbri);default restoration (across all associated terbri)

column2: Numeral: Some but not all.
column3: Strictly more than 0 (or 1, depending on context) but strictly less than {ro}. Use "{pidau'e}" for "strictly more than 0% but strictly less than 1 (of)". Note that if dau'e X satisfy p(X), then (a different) dau'e X satisfy Not(p(x)), for any preposition p of at least one variable.

column2: attitudinal: equal intensity attitudinal relativizer
column3: Specifies an equal intensity - relative to any previously specified intensity of the same UI/cmavo. See also {mau'i}, {me'ai}, {cu'i}

column2: Quantifier modifier: endowment of existential import - repeal of existential import/abstention from claiming existence - assertion of non-existence
column3: The immediately previous word must be a quantifier (such as {ro}) or quantified variable. This word endows the quantification with existential import. If this word is immediately followed by "{cu'i}" (thereby producing "{dau'ocu'i}"), then all existential import is explicitly repealed (so that it does not apply) and the result is agnostic on existence; "{rodau'o}" is technically exactly the same as "{ro}" alone according to the CLL and means "(for) each/every/all [x, P(x) is true], and strictly more than zero [x] (are asserted to) exist"; meanwhile, "{rodau'ocu'i}" is a more correct translation of the universal quantifier ("all", "for any/every") in modern logic/math, but it very clearly states that the person is purposefully and knowingly abstaining from asserting existence of non-existence. If it is immediately followed by "{nai}" (thereby producing "{dau'onai}"), then non-existence is explicitly, purposefully, and knowingly claimed; the result is more of an 'IF' statement ("if X were to exist, then proposition p(X) would be true (of (all of) X); but X do not exist."). On its own, "{rodau'o} lo broda cu brode" is equivalent to "ro lo broda cu brode .ije da broda".

column2: variable identifier article: refer to the referents of the variable having the following predicate as its name; such a variable may be implicitly bound by {PA broda} or {LE broda} phrases; if no such variable has been previously bound, the referents are left to the context to determine; the referents are not claimed to actually satisfy the predicate after which the variable is named.
vocative: pausing conversation
default value (re)specification/(re)assignment/(re)definition/over-write; set new default value (terbri-specific; permanent)
column3: Terminates immediately previous sumti.  The immediately following (next) unfilled terbri at that level of nesting is affected by this word; if no such terbri exists at that level of nesting, this word's affects apply to the next unfilled terbri in the immediately higher level of nesting (unnested once); if no unfilled terbri exist at any/all levels of nesting and following the immediately previous sumti (even if unfilled terbri exist prior to that sumti), this word has no meaningful affect and can be ignored.  This word must be followed by a sumti; for the purpose of this explanation, this sumti will be xy (as in "de'ai xy").  The affected terbri is defined to default to the value xy (the sumti as a whole, including gadri, tanru, relative clauses, etc.); in other words, when not explicitly filled or when filled be {di'au}, the sumti value filling the affected terbri is that of xy.  This affect remains in effect until the end of the text/conversation or until/unless the default setting of this terbri explicitly redefined (overriding by {di'ei} is temporary/only applies to that usage). If xy is {zo'e}, the default value is completely general and elliptical; thus, permanently overriding a default setting on a specific terbri may be done by "de'ai zo'e". The scope of this word fully encompasses and ends with the following sumti (xy); thus, the second sumti, same-/higher-level terminator, a FA cmavo, etc. following this word ends the new default specification in addition to its other functions.  Additionally, this word does not actually fill the affected terbri with any particular sumti/value; it merely defines its default value hereinafter. CAUTION: Thus, the second same-level sumti uttered actually fills the affected terbri; in order to access the newly-defined default value of the terbri immediately after definition, follow "xy" (with terminator) immediately with implicit (or possibly explicit) "{zo'e}" (possibly necessitating terminators), "{di'au}", or "xy" itself. Moreover, therefore, the default value defined by this word does not immediately/necessarily affect the truth value of the statement in which it appears (it only does so if the second following sumti is not {di'au}, implicit (or possibly) explicit {zo'e}, or xy itself); however, in all future uses of the brivla to which the terbri belongs, unless explicitly filled with a sumti of a different value, the truth value of those statements will be affected.  Also, {su} does not erase this new definition of default. If the affected terbri is naturally defined to have a default or if it has no naturally defined default value, this word semi-permanently over-writes them. See also: {dai'o}, {de'au}, {de'ei}, {de'oi}, {di'au}, {di'ei}, {di'oi}.
column5: default assignment;default specification over-write;new default assignment;new default definition

column2: gafyzmico: Cancellation (permanent) of all defaults in immediately previous word
column3: Cancels/overrides/ignores/"kills" all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and {di'au} that may fill the terbri of that word are general in potential reference (modulo context) and do not necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-exterior/“official” definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default override (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so overridden all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. Affects all future uses of the word (permanent), until the end of the text/conversation or explicitly undone in some manner. See also: {dau'a}, {de'oi}, {zmico}.

column2: mekso ternary operator: positive super-logarithm; the super-logarithm (inverse operator of hyper-operator with respect to "height" of power tower) of $a$ with base $b$ and of order $c-2$.
column3: c is a nonnegative number (currently, must be an integer). Currently, b must be a positive integer in order to be well-defined. c=3 produces the normal/standard/simple logarithm; c=4 produces slog. In conventional English notation (not necessarily Lojbanic), this is the left-inverse of the same-order hyperoperator. See also: {te'au'u}, {fe'au'u}, {dei'au'o}.

column2: letteral for e.
column3: Synonymous with the original CLL definition of .{ebu}.

column2: mathematical ordered n-ary operator: (pointwise) functional left composition; $X_1 \circ X_2$.
column3: Inputs must be appropriate functions; this outputs a function; follow by "{ku'e} ({boi})" in order to include/apply the output function to arguments (thereby producing a number). $a_1 \circ a_2 \circ \dots \circ a_n = a_1(a_2(\dots(a_n(\cdot))\dots))$ for any positive integer or countable infinity $n$ and functions $a_i$ for all integer $i < n+1$. Replaces all of the inputs with a (possibly stripped, as appropriate) tuple; for replacing a single argument in a multivariate function with a function (either evaluated or not), use (partial) (e)valuation. Left compose multiple terms by separating the function names with "{boi}".

column2: mekso k-ary operator, for natural k and 1 < k < 5: ordered input $(f, g, S, m)$ where $f$ and $g$ are functions, $S$ is a set of positive integers or "ro" (="all"), and $m$ is 0 or 1 (as a toggle); output is a function equivalent to the function $f$ as applied to an input ordered tuple with $g$ applied to the entries/terms with indices in $S$ (or to all entries/terms if $S$="ro") if $m$=$0$, or $g$ left-composed with the same if $m$=$1$.
column3: $S$="ro" is default case (making this operator binary or ternary); $S$ must be a set or "ro" (no bare integers); $m$ = 0 is the default case (making this operator binary or ternary); use "{mau'au}" and "{zai'ai}" in order to quote $f$ and $g$ each; the indices in the implicit tuple mentioned in the definition are positive natural numbers such that said tuple is of form $(x_1, x_2, x_3, ..., x_n, ...)$; thus, notationally, a concrete output of this function, as applied to the aforementioned concrete input tuple, is of form $($fa'ai'ai$(f, g, S, m))(x_1, x_2, ..., x_n, ...)$. For example, maintaining this notation, if $S$="ro" and $m$=$0$, then the output is $f(g(x_1), g(x_2), ..., g(x_n), ...)$; if $S$ = Set(1, 3, 23) and $m$=$0$, then the output is $f(g(x_1), x_2, g(x_3), x_4, x_5, ..., x_{21}, x_{22}, g(x_{23}), x_{24}, x_{25}, ..., x_n, ...)$; vel sim. If $h$ is the function output by this expression when $m$=$0$, then for the same inputs (ignoring $m$), $g \circ h$ is the function output by the same expression but with $m$=$1$. Obviously, in order to be meaningful, the output of each step along the way must be defined. If $S$ is the empty set and $g$ is defined, then the output is just the function $f$ if $m$=$0$. The output of this operator is a function, so it must have explicit input supplied to it ("it" here referring to the output of this operator) in order to actually have an explicit and concrete result; use mathematical brackets around this operator and its inputs when doing so, particularly when $S$ or $m$ is omitted (as being equal to the default "ro" or 0 resp.).

column2: mathematical unary operator: map notation
column3: Input is unary: a function f; the output is an ordered tuple: (the domain set of f, the codomain set of f, the image of f, the mapping rule of f (defined with a dummy variable which is taken to belong to the the domain set of f), the graph/plot (set of input-output pairs) of f). Might be useful for lambda calculus, etc. Equip the output with {ma'o} in order to use as a/the function. Extract a term in the tuple in order to use it directly.

column2: nonce place; tags sumti with an unspecified connection to the bridi
column3: This is used as a shorthand for the cmavo-compound faxinoboi, which allows arbitrary quantification of variables in a bridi outside of the prenex, giving them a defined scope. Each usage is a new unspecified place for the bridi it appears in, multiple usages do not have overlapping places.

column2: Unary mekso operator: reverse finite ordered sequence, tuple, list, string, etc.

{fai'a} - translation marker\n{fai'anai} - original/native version: marks a construct as having been translated and therefore particularly (possibly, but not necessarily) susceptible to the errors or limitations associated with translation (especially if the translator is unsure of the best result/option)
column3: Might be useful for translations of idioms, songs, poetry, wordplay, political speeches, nuanced phrasings, (in stories) prophecies, riddles, rhymes, etc. Followed by members of selma'o CAI, the marker indicates the corresponding level of uncertainty in the best possible choice of translation according to the opinion/expectation/judgment of the speaker/translator. Also may indicate a cultural or linguistic gap. For Lojban especially, it might be useful when various ambiguities arise in the original text and the translator is forced to pick interpretations from among them.

column2: digit/number: the second Feigenbaum constant α = 2.502907875095892822283902873218...
digit/number: first Feigenbaum constant δ = 4.669 201 609 102 990 671 853 203 821 578(...).

Pendent preposition. Introduces a dangling argument that doesn't take part in the surrounding argument structure; similarly to {zo'u}, it may be used for pre-declaring a quantification, or for introducing an argument that will be later referred to anaphorically. The pronoun {zoi'i} is automatically bound to the argument introduced by {fai'i}.
digit/number: phi, the "golden ratio" (approx. = 1.6180...); the ratio a/b such that it equals (a+b)/a
digit/number: the fine-structure constant $\alpha \approx 7.2973525698(\dots)*10^{(-3)} \approx 1/137.035999074$.
sentence fence: the speaker is done speaking and signals to the addressee that they may now speak up if they so desire.
column3: The speaker may change their mind and add a new sentence after this cmavo has been uttered. In the meantime the addressee is free to speak in their turn.

column2: end of all Lojban text, forever.
column3: Once this word is said, no more Lojban text will ever be parsed, in any form. See also {su'u'u'u'u'u'u'u}.

column2: Convert operator to being entrywise.
column3: Applied to an operator by immediately following it; breaks the symmetry which that operator may have had: the first argument of the operator is to be a tensor or (multidimensional) list, or a set, or something with many internal terms, entries, elements, components, etc; the subsequent arguments of the operator are arbitrary. The result is to apply the operator with the subsequent arguments to each term, entry, elements, etc. of the first argument individually. For example, for matrix A=((1, 2), (3, 4)), A+(fau'a)10 = ((11, 12),(13, 14)) and A^2 = ((7, 10), (15, 22)); however, A^(fau'a)2 = ((1, 4), (9, 16)); likewise, sin(A) = A - (1/3)A^3 + (1/5)A^5 - ..., but sin(fau'a)(A) = ((sin(1), sin(2)), (sin(3), sin(4))), which is meant to show the distribution of the sin() function to each entry of A, although it also happens to be equivalent to applying the Taylor expansion to A via "fau'a" as well. Caution must be used: matrix addition or scalar multiplication of matrices already have this distributional property, so this word is not needed in those cases; in fact, A+(fau'a)A would yield ((1+A, 2+A), (3+A, 4+A)), which is nonsensical (because, without "fau'a", the addition of a scalar entry to a matrix is undefined).
column5: distribution of function to entries;entrywise function application

column2: non-logical connective: antirespectively; unmixed but reverse ordered distributed association.
column3: Works together with {fa'u}; given an ordering by {fa'u}, the terms connected by this word are (applied) in opposite order.

column2: Iteratively applies "fau'a" to each resultant operator until all operators resolve.
column3: Let matrix A = ((1, 2), (3, 4)); then A +(fau'ai) A = A +({fau'a}*) A = ((1 +(fau'a*) A, 2 +(fau'a*) A), (3 +(fau'a*) A, 4 +(fau'a*) A)) = (( ((1+1, 1+2), (1+3, 1+4)), ((2+1, 2+2),(2+3, 2+4)) ), ( ((3+1, 3+2), (3+3, 3+4)), ((4+1, 4+2), (4+3, 4+4)) )), which has all of the additions resolve (so the iteration terminates) - the result is a 2-by-2 matrix in which each entry is itself a 2-by-2 matrix. If the operators resolve after differing iteration counts, then the process continues only on the unresolved ones with the resolved ones being held constant and saved.

column2: two-tier function map/assignment writer notation: X1 (ordered list, no repetitious terms) maps termwise-respectively to X2 (ordered list; may be repetitious but must have exactly as many terms as X1)
column3: So named because, in mathematical notation, the domain set of the function is written down in some order in its entirety and then, below it, the range of the function is written so that each image and preimage line up vertically with their appropriate/respective partner. Really useful when mapping from a countable set/object that is either human-small or in which the pattern is clear. Occasionally used for a more explicit form of notation for permutations (in which cycle decomposition is not necessarily as evident, but the structure as a how is, at least, explicit). The ith term of X1 is mapped to the ith term of X2; there is no knowledge of what happens to any value that is not term of list X1.  Useful for lambda calculus.
column5: assignment writer notation;function map writer notation

column2: iterated function left-composition with self: f∘f∘...∘f, n times.
column3: First argument must be a function(al) or some object f that can be left-composed with itself (and which is unary); second argument is a real number (usually nonnegative integer) n for which n compositions of f makes sense; the result is f left-composed with itself n times and, as such, is itself a function(al) or other object of the same sort as f (therefore, it can then be applied to an m-tuple input, where m is less than or equal to the arity of f; if f is a function, then the output will generally not be a number in the codomain of f, but rather a function itself). This word is a shortcut for longer expressions. See also: {fa'ai}, {se'au}, {te'a}, {fe'a}.

column2: mekso ternary operator: inverse function of input function $X_1$ with respect to its input $X_2$, taken on branch or restricted domain $X_3$ ("domain" being of $X_1$).
column3: The output of this function is itself a function of the same arity as $X_1$. $X_3$ often omitted due to obviousness (or due to lack of need/due to well-definition) or convention. $X_1$ should be a function supplied in "{zau'au}" quotes; that function itself should be at least unary and the input against which the inverse is being taken in an n-ary $X_1$ is $X_2$. $X_2$ should technically be a input slot index or domain (or subspace/projection thereof), but a named and non-evaluated dummy variable symbol can be supplied if the slot ordering or domain terms (vel sim.) are not well-specified. Because the output is a function, it can itself (that is: the output's self) have an input; use "{bai'i'i}" or an equivalent thereof for this purpose in most situations. For example, if $f(x,y,z)=w,g=fau'i(f,2),v=(x,y,z)$, and $u=bai'i'i(v,2,w)=(x,w,z)$, then $g(u)=f^{-1}_2(x,w,z)=y$. In English notation, "$fau'i(f,n)$" might be notated as "$inv(f,n)$". See also: "{fau'e}" (this word acts as a better-specified case of iteration order $n=-1$ for "fau'e").

column2: any way, under any events
Forgive me!/I'm sorry!
mekso ternary operator: positive super-root; the $b$th super-root (inverse operator of hyper-operator with respect to base) of $a$ of order $c-2$.
column3: c must be nonnegative (and currently must also be an integer). c=3 yields the basic/typical bth root function on $a$ (undoes exponentiation); c=4 yields the bth sroot (undoes tetration). In conventional English notation (not necessarily Lojbanic), this is the right-inverse on the same-order hyperoperator. See: {dei'au'o}, {te'au'u}, {de'au'u}

column2: location event contour tense: perfective in space; beyond the place of ...
location event contour tense: continuative in space; throughout the place of ...
location event contour tense: initiative in space; on this edge of ...
location event contour tense: achievative in space; at the point of ...
binary mekso operator: divided by (fraction): a/(b...)
column3: This is exactly the same as {fe'i} {vei} except that it is strictly binary (not n-ary). It must be explicitly terminated by {ve'o} or the end of the number construct. This is useful for Lojban and English because people seem to tend to give high priority to "/" in mathematical expressions, despite the notation.

column2: location event contour tense: completive in space; at the far end of ...
tense: right here; refers to current spatial reference absolutely
column3: *Note: Not currently accepted by grammar parsers.* It may be desirable to separate the spatial and time senses of the word {nau}; this is one proposed solution. Alternative: {bu'u} {nau'u}. See {zva'ati}, {ca'abna}

column2: location tense interval modifier: never in space; objectively quantified tense.
location event contour tense: anticipative in space; up to the edge of ...
$b_1$=$f_1$ roars/snarls/growls angrily utterance $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$x_1$=$b_1$=$f_1$ is sulky/sullen/[in a bad mood] about/[because of] $x_2$=$b_2$=$f_3$ (action/state/property)
$r_1$ (event) angers $f_1$.
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ angry / mad at $x_3$ for $x_4$ (action / state / property); $x_1$ angers / provokes / stirs up $x_2$.
column3: Unlike the usual sense of "to anger", the person causing x2 to be angry (i.e., x1) isn't necessarily the target of the resulting anger (x3).

column2: $fi_1$ is a lungfish/salamanderfish (subclass Dipnoi) of species $fi_2$.
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a lung cancer [malignant disease] in $x_2$=$k_2$=$f_2$
column5: carcinoma of the lung;lung cancer;pulmonary carcinoma

column2: $s_1$ is a cent coin issued by $s_2$ in monetary system $f_3$.
$x_1$ is a sewer carrying waste through $x_2$ that stretches from $x_3$ to $x_4$ and goes through points $x_5$ (set)
$x_1$=$f_2$=$c_1$ abandons / forsakes / leaves behind $x_2$=$f_1$=$c_2$
$x_1$ recycles $x_2$ for new purpose $x_3$.
$p_1$ (agent) throws away waste $p_2$ on/at locus $p_3$
$c_1$ is intended to be disposed of after use; $c_1$ is disposable.
column5: designed to be thrown away;disposable;intended to be thrown away;throwaway

column2: $t_1$ is a disposable tool/utensil/resource used for doing $t_2$; $t_1$ is intended to be thrown away after doing $t_2$.
$t_1$ is an incinerator for burning waste $t_2$=$f_1$.
$b_1$ is a trash bin/trash can/recycle bin with contents $b_2$=$f_1$, made of material $b_3$.
column5: dustbin;garbage bin;garbage pail;recycle bin;refuse bin;refuse can;rubbish bin;trash bin;trash can;waste bin

column2: $d_1$ is a refuse bag with refuse $d_2$=$f_1$, and of material $d_3$.
column3: Any bag with trash inside counts as trash bag in this context.
column5: bin bag;bin liner;dustbin liner;garbage bag;refuse bag;refuse sack;rubbish bag;trash bag

column2: $x_1$=$g_1$ [person/agent] leaves waste product/wastes $x_2$=$f_1$ by event/activity $x_3$=$f_2$=$g_2$
$x_1$ removes waste/trash $x_2$ from $x_3$.
column5: clean;perform waste removal;remove trash;remove waste;separate waste;take out;take out waste;throw away;throw out

column2: $s_1$ is garbology based on methology $s_3$.
$x_1$ is a landfill or other area where refuses/garbages are disposed of.
$c_1$ is a goddess (female deity) of people(s)/religion $c_2$ with dominion over $c_3$ [sphere].
column3: Cf. {nakcei}, {fetsi}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {krici}, {censa}, {malsi}. Recommended to be used only use when contrasted with {nakcei} or femininity of the deity is to be emphasized/important.

column2: $c_1$ is gynophilous [sexually attracted to women] in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
column3: This word is only about sexual interest in females; other sexual interests are irrelevant. Cf. {nakcinse}, {fetfetcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

column2: $fa_1$=$fe_1$ is an aunt of $fa_2$ by bond/tie $fa_3$.
$c_1$=$f_1$ is female and gynophilous/gay/bisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$
column3: This word is about female homosexuality and bisexuality. See also {fetcinse}, {naknakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {relcinse}.

column2: $f_1$=$n_1$ is an unmarried woman under law/custom/tradition $s_3$.
$x_1$=$t_1$ is panties/knickers/boy shorts (female genital underwear), serving purpose $x_2$=$t_3$
column3: Female genitalia/crotch/vulva-covering type of underwear. Needn't be worn by female/woman/girl but garment need be made for female genitalia/pubic region in some manner (see {nakpibyta'u}/{pibyta'u} for male/non-defined counterpart). Cf. {nerta'u}, {taxfrbikini}, {tatyta'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a gamete of female $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a wife of $x_2$ (spouse) according to marriage tradition/custom/law $x_3$.
$t_1$ is a matriarch of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.
$x_1$ is an ovary of $x_2$.
$f_1$=$b_1$=$m_1$ is a huge/enormous/very big female being in property/dimensions $b_2$ as compared with standard/norm $b_3$. $f_1$=$m_1$=$b_1$ is a giantess.
$x1$ is/demonstrates/exhibits sexual orientation toward females in situation $x2$ by standard $x3$
column3: In a gender binary, this word covers half of each heterosexuality and homosexuality. It is not strict (in other words, bisexuals are both male- and female-attracted). Could be useful for transexuals with a definite preference, as well. See also: {naktricinse}

column2: $c_1$=$f_1$ growls/snarls/roars c2 [non-linguistic utterance] in anger at $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$x_1$=$j_1$ is the cellulose of fibre $x_2$=$j_2$=$f_1$
$x_2$ (property) is satisfied by a number different from that expected by $x_1$ with likelihood $x_3$

$x_1$=$p_1$ thinks that $x_2$=$f_1$ differs from/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_3$=$f_2$ in property/dimension/quality $x_4$=$f_3$; $x_1$ distinguishes between $x_2$ and $x_3$ because of differing property/dimension/quality $x_4$.
column3: Use {su'ai} for distinguishing among more than two things.

column2: $b_1$ becomes different/changes/transforms from $f_2$ in property/dimension/quantity $f_3$ under conditions $b_3$.
$s_1$ (set) differs/are distinct from/contrasts with/are unlike each other in property/dimension/quantity $f_3$.
$x_1$ is an injective function (distinctness-preserving function) from $x_2$ (domain) to $x_3$ (codomain).
column3: This is a {brapagjvo} (one of its veljvo is the zi'evla "{stodraunju}"). Let $f$ be the sumti which fills $x_1$; for any $y$ and $z$ in $x_2$, $y$ =/= $z$ iff $f(y)$ =/= $f(z)$.

column2: $c_1$ is a fish-eater of fish species $f_2$.
$x_1$ is a fiesta
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'space-int-props' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: (FEhE interval-property)+. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: location tense interval modifier: always in space; objectively quantified tense.
location event contour tense: superfective in space; continuing too far beyond ...
$x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
column3: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

column2: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
column3: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).
column3: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus $x_{2}$ (object/nu) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of $x_{2}$, gender $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
column3: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column3: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$.  See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
column3: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Re. $x_3$, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
column3: Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}).  See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
column3: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
column3: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
column3: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
column3: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
column3: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
column3: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
column3: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

column2: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
column3: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column3: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column3: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum.  See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
column3: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
column3: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column3: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
column3: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
column3: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
column3: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
column3: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
column3: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pulls/tugs/draws/drags $x_{2}$ by handle/at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ relies/depends/counts on/trusts $x_{2}$ to bring about/ensure/maintain $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is lactic/dairy.
$x_{1}$ (force) lifts/applies raising/supporting force to $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$ in gravity well $x_{4}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be an abstract); verb lift/raise/elevate (= {lafmuvgau}). See also {farlu}, {plipe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
column3: Also touching, contiguous, against.  See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences $x_{2}$ (event/experience); $x_{2}$ happens to $x_{1}$.
column3: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) $x_1$ is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}).  See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.
column3: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= {seljda} for reordered places); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= {selterjda} for reordered places); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= {terjda} for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}).  See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) swims in fluid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
column3: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a floor/bottom/ground of $x_{2}$.
column3: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}).  See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) washes/cleanses $x_{2}$ of soil/contaminant $x_{3}$ in/with cleaning material(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
column3: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
column3: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
column3: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
column3: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

column2: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
column3: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
attitudinal modifier: \n{fu'i} - easy\n{fu'inai} - difficult.
end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
letteral for f.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
{zgana} modal, 1st place                            to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur; used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].
attitudinal: \n{i'o} - appreciation\n{i'onai} - envy.
attitudinal: \n{io} - respect\n{ionai} - disrespect.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
vocative: \n{je'e} - roger (ack)\n{je'enai} - negative acknowledge
column3: used to acknowledge offers and thanks

column2: logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
{krati} modal, 1st place                            represented by ...
{ckaji} modal, 1st place                            characterizing ...
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
column3: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

column2: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
{kulnu} modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: \n{la'a} - probability\n{la'anai} - improbability.
the referent of (indirect pointer); uses the referent of a sumti as the desired sumti.
name descriptor: the set of those named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
name descriptor: the mass of individual(s) named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
{lidne} modal, 1st place                            preceded by ...; non-time sequencing.
abstractor: experience abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
elidable terminator: end math express.(mex) sumti; end mex-to-sumti conversion; usually elidable.
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
{manri} modal, 1st place (by standard 2)            in reference frame ...
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
{mleca} modal, 1st place (a lesser)                 undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
{cmene} modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
digit/number: less than.
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
column3: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

column2: the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction; identifies speaker.\n{mi'enai} - denial of identity
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.
$x_1$ is a galaxy, of contents $x_2$ and other characteristics/parameters $x_3$; $x_1$ is galactic.
$x_1$ is turned off / deactivated, not performing function $x_2$
$x_1$ is the sensory media content of type/stimulating sense/containing experience information $x_2$ of recording/broadcast/media $x_3$ displayed/produced by medium/device $x_4$.
column3: Generalizes/encompasses both of {vidvi} and {snavi} (where $x_2$ is visual/video or audio, respectively), so-called '4D' experiences (which have jostling/kinetoceptive and olfactory stimuli), the feelies from Huxley's /Brave New World/, and other stuff.

column2: $x_1$ reflects jbobau language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_2$
column3: Alternative to {lojbo} based on the observation that the word "Lojban" has effectively become an exonym, as the majority of speakers now refer to Lojban as "lo/le/la jbobau" in the language itself. Especially used by speakers of nonstandard varieties of Lojban to distinguish dialects from the official standard of "CLL" Lojban.

column2: *$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
column3: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
column3: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
column3: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

column2: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
column3: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality.
